caption.p: The 3D graph shows the predicted and calculated pharmacological activities of artemisinin ( 86) and its analogs, such as 12α-OH-artemisinin ( 87), 12β-OH- artemisinin ( 88), artemether ( 89), arteether ( 90), artelinate ( 91), and artesunic acid ( 92). According to the PASS data, artemisinin and its analogs ( 86– 92) show selective activity against obligate intracellular protozoan parasites belonging to the genera Plasmodium, Toxoplasma, Leishmania, and Coccidia, which is the main pharmacological activity with a confidence level of more than 90%. In addition, all these endoperoxides show antifungal activity against the opportunistic pathogenic yeasts Candida and Cryptococcus, as well as anticancer activity for some compounds; the confidence level exceeds 90 percent.
